definition: year after year/with each passing year/over the years

sentences.english: Sandier soils will require lighter and more frequent fertilizations and slightly heavier yearly rates.
sentences.chinese: 沙性大的土壤需要少量多施，以后逐年加大用量。

sentences.english: Yearby year their affection for each other grew stronger.
sentences.chinese: 他们之间的爱逐年加深。

sentences.english: Results Students obtained higher grades in the examination after reform.
sentences.chinese: 结果采取教改措施后，学生的考试成绩逐年提高。

sentences.english: But since then cars have gotten physically safer every year.
sentences.chinese: 不过自那以后汽车的物力安全性逐年增加。

sentences.english: The number of buses in this city is increasing year-by-year .
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的公共汽车的数量在逐年增长。

sentences.english: Digital images are massive, and they get bigger and bigger and bigger every year.
sentences.chinese: 数字图像是非常大的，并且还在逐年加大。

sentences.english: There has been a progressive decrease in population every year in this city.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的人口在逐年递减。

sentences.english: One of the most formidable enemies hazarding human health is tumour, the incidence of which rises sharply year after year.
sentences.chinese: 肿瘤是人类健康大敌，其发病率也在逐年上升。

sentences.english: "Dwindling water levels and pollution are compromising what remains." nps.gov/ever
sentences.chinese: 逐年下降的水位和污染仍在影响着剩下的地方。

sentences.english: Pottery is a craft alive, but the pottery artisans are decreasing.
sentences.chinese: 制陶是个手艺活，但制陶的手艺人却逐年减少。

sentences.english: However, this image of Santa Claus has evolved over the years.
sentences.chinese: 然而，圣诞老公公的形象可是逐年发展来的喔。

sentences.english: A significant secular increase has occurred in particulate pollution over the North Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 在北大西洋上粒子的污染明显地逐年增加。

sentences.english: The rankings indicate two thirds of African governments are getting better year-by-year.
sentences.chinese: 这一排名显示三分之二的非洲国家政府都在逐年改进。

sentences.english: The CEOs were a fairly homogeneous-looking group made up almost entirely of middle-aged white men.
sentences.chinese: 照片中的CEO们气质相当，几乎全是逐年男性白人。

sentences.english: From year to year the Saracen section also deteriorates more and more.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教徒地区也逐年越来越恶化。

sentences.english: Awards are provided for one year and must be re-applied yearly.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金每次核定一学年，须逐年申请。

definition: to increase by degrees/in increasing order/incremental/progressive
more critical with every passing day
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
(of prices, rates etc) to remain high
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
